intro: Arabidopsis cebennensis, commonly known as the Cebenna mustard, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Arabidopsis cebennensis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
